image.title: The Standard News Feeds
image.description: Standardmedia.co.ke We deliver breaking news from across Kenya and the globe and information on the latest top stories, business, sports and entertainment headlines. Follow the news as it happens through: special reports, videos, audio, photo gallerie and many more.

item.title: State's most expensive call: Man loses case on Sh66m tender offered via phone
item.description: Businessman Paul Otieno must loathe the day a senior official from the Ministry of Health called him to install medical equipment in 7 containers that were part of Beyond Zero Campaign clinics.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Kenya loses Sh3 billion daily from protests, KEPSA says
item.description: KEPSA projects Kenya loses Sh3b daily owing to looting and property destruction occasioned by protests, says the country cannot afford existing political activities.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Explained: State vs Official Visit
item.description: A state visit is a solemn ritualistic or formal visit by a Head of State not the government to a foreign country, at the invitation of the host president.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Kioni, Murathe lose appeal to regain Jubilee party to Ruto allies
item.description: The Political Parties Dispute Tribunal has upheld East African Legislative Assembly (EALA) MP Kanini Kega as the Jubilee Party Secretary General.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Payslips to grow thinner as new taxes kick in this month
item.description: The housing levy has the biggest impact, reducing the take-home for employees by Sh1,350 with Kenyans feeling overtaxed with the new targets.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Calls for arrest of Raila Odinga are misguided- legal experts
item.description: Legal experts now argue that the suggestion to have Raila Odinga arrested is ill-advised.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: It's back to the streets on Wednesday- Raila
item.description: Azimio to resume nationwide protests on Wednesday, July 12; rejects resolve by Kenya Kwanza to allow the IEBC selection panel proceed with mandate.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Why taxman keeps falling short in tax targets
item.description: The underperformance over the 2022/23 financial year had the impact of pushing up the fiscal deficit to Sh840 billion from the earlier Sh824 billion.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Court quashes appointment of 50 CASs by President William Ruto
item.description: The court quashes the appointment of 50 CASs terming it unconstitutional, arguing that there was public participation for only 23 positions, not the extra 27.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: How implementation of Finance Act will hurt you
item.description: Other than pushing up transportation costs, higher fuel prices expected to impact on other economic sectors. Employers have warned housing levy could lead to stagnation in job creation.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: EPRA to announce new fuel prices as 16 per cent VAT takes effect
item.description: EPRA to announce new fuel prices in compliance with the Finance Act which introduces a 16 per cent VAT on petroleum products.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Raila Odinga preaches tax defiance, protests, repealing the Finance Act
item.description: Raila Odinga says Azimio's nationwide protests to resume Friday, July 7; asks supporters to meet at Kamukunji grounds in Nairobi.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Siaya Deputy Governor William Oduol survives impeachment
item.description: Siaya Deputy Governor William Oduol has survived impeachment after 27 out of 43 senators voted to keep him in office.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Ogier wins 2023 Safari Rally as Toyota makes a 1-2-3-4 finish
item.description: Carl Tundo was the best placed Kenyan in 12th place in this year's race.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Finance Bill battle far from over, Raila's troops warns Kenya Kwanza
item.description: Leaders allied to Azimio One Kenya Coalition have maintained that the battle over the controversial Finance Bill is not yet over.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: DP Gachagua: I disagree with CS Kuria's remarks on advertising, we're a democracy
item.description: Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua says he does not agree with Trade CS Moses Kurias statement that the government should stop advertising with Nation Media Group.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: TransCentury placed on receivership over Sh4.8b Equity Bank loan
item.description: Embattled investments firm TransCentury is down to its knees after being placed under administration over a Sh4.8 billion loan.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Budget 2023-2024: How Health, Education ministries fared
item.description: Treasury Cabinet Secretary Njuguna Ndungu has proposed an allocation of Sh141.2 billion to the Health docket.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Keroche gets new CEO after Tabitha Karanja takes a bow
item.description: Anaya takes over from Nakuru Senator Tabitha Karanja who has stepped down after 25 years at the helm of the first large breweries in Kenya owned by a non-multinational company.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Is William Ruto changing tune on Finance Bill?
item.description: Tough stance displayed by President has raised questions on the essence of public participation. However, National Assembly Majority Whip Silvanus Osoro, have hinted at changes.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Sh24 billion too little too late for schools, say education officials
item.description: According to head teachers, the Sh4 billion released on Thursday is 20 per cent of 2022 capitation for third term, less than what Education CS Machogu promised would be sent to schools.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: New DPP to decide fate of DCI officers linked to disappearance of two Indians, Kenyan
item.description: DPP informed magistrate Gideon Oenga that the government chemist is yet to analyse DNA collected in a bid to match them with the two Indians and driver who vanished last year.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Azimio urges MPs to unanimously reject Finance Bill
item.description: Raila Odinga warned that if the demands of the opposition are not met, the government should be prepared for a return of protests. He urged Azimio MPs to reject the Bill.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Man 'directed by angels' returns to haunt incoming NIS boss
item.description: According to a self-declared witch doctor named Stephen Mangira, Noordin Haji, who was an intelligence officer at the time, played a key role in the "great injustice" inflicted upon him.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Orengo speaks on graft claims, invites EACC to probe his deputy
item.description: The governor has asked the EACC to undertake a thorough investigation into the role of the deputy governor in presiding over the committee of pending bills.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: President Ruto launches Hustler fund for Chamas
item.description: He said loans being given in this phase of the hustler programme range from Sh50,000 as the minimum amount and may grow up to Sh1 million.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: President Ruto nominates two to PS positions
item.description: President William Ruto has nominated Salome Wairimu Muhia-Beacco as the Principal Secretary for Correctional Services in the Ministry of Interior.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Fact check: Advance tax to be paid for commercial vehicles
item.description: The advance tax is exempted to tractors or trailers used for agricultural purposes. Private cars are not included in new rate unless being used for business.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: ATPU seizes items from Pastor Ezekiel Odero's New Life Centre and Church
item.description: Anti-Terror Police Unit (ATPU) have seized computer drives, communication gadgets, holy water, and handkerchiefs from Pastor Ezekiel Odero's New Life Centre and Church.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Azimio's strategy to make Kalonzo ready for a duel with Ruto in 2027
item.description: Azimios strategy is to ripen Kalonzo by increasing his prominence in a bid to portray him as the next face of the struggle against oppression.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital
